title: How much is it to file a fl-145 family law form interrogatories
question: Discovery of income , debts and property
question_tags: Divorce,Dividing debts in a divorce,Divorce petitions and complaints,Divorce and bankruptcy,Bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Divorce and family,Family law,Discovery,Motions
answers: You don't file it with the court but you serve it on the other party after a petition for divorce and summons has been served on the other party.

You do not file form interrogatories. You simply serve them on the other party and include a proof of service with the document. The other party then has 30 days (35 if you mail-serve the interrogatories) to provide you with verified responses.

If a proceeding is already on file, it costs nothing. The problem is making sure you get complete and accurate answers from the other side. Unfortunately often it is just the start of the discovery dance.
